column4: hitman1985one thing about linux is that you don't really need lot of power, unless you are doing something very intensive
memory helps, but cpu speed doesn't matter too much
i am jealous :) i only got 1GB of memory
memory helps building anything :) i have installed gentoo with less memory :)
especially for something like OOo i easily swapped when building with just 2GB ram
i have paid $45 for a stick of 256MB dimm
nevermind :) u beat me
yep, i'm an old geek ;-)
i am young geek and proud of it :)
i have matrox millenium with 2MB ram i paid $350 for
yea i think it might have been a 4MB millenium, was around 1996/7
three separate controller cards?
1. built in, 2, built in with RAID, and 3, add on
it should probably be trying to boot off the built in one
when i take out the add in card, system boots just fine
hmm maybe the add in card is doing something weird to the bios
of course this is an old m/b dual PIII
those were fun especially running dual overclocked celerons on them ;-)
hehe well for now it's simple dual PIII @ 1G
i think system doesn't like 3 ctrl cards
maybe not
i think system has issues having 3 controller cards
